text.tspan: Change in coal consumption and sulphur dioxide emissions, 1965 to
Sulphur dioxide (SOâ‚‚) is an air pollutant formed from the burning of fuels that contain sulphur, such as coal. Countries can
reduce SOâ‚‚ emissions by burning less coal, or installing desulphurization technologies which remove sulphur from the
Data source: Community Emissions Data System (CEDS) 2024; Energy Institute (2024)
